snippet: I WILL say this about West Coast winemakers: They are never boring. Well, almost never. Some of their latest experiments are transforming old techniques and old varietals into surprising innovations.    Take, for example, ZD Wines, an old-line pro...
lead_paragraph: I WILL say this about West Coast winemakers: They are never boring. Well, almost never. Some of their latest experiments are transforming old techniques and old varietals into surprising innovations. Take, for example, ZD Wines, an old-line producer of classic varietals -- cabernet, chardonnay and pinot noir -- that started in Sonoma County in the late 1960's and moved to the Napa Valley in 1979. The winery went along quietly and efficiently until a few months ago, when it released -- unleashed may be the word -- Abacus.
abstract: Frank Prial's Wine Talk column on experimentation among West Coast winemakers; drawing (M)

headline.main: Out West, More Adventures in Winemaking
